title: A+ Green Bean and Walnut Casserole

instructions.1: Melt spread in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and onion; cook, stirring frequently, for 10 minutes. Stir in flour; cook and stir for 5 minutes more. Slowly add stock and bring mixture to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in half & half and season with salt and pepper; set aside.
instructions.2: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook beans in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain well then add to mushroom sauce; toss to coat with mixture. Transfer to an 11 x 7-inch baking dish.
instructions.3: Stir together all topping ingredients until well blended and sprinkle around the edge of the beans.
instructions.4: Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown on top.

questions.question: In Step 2, is the mixture from Step 1 being used?
Is mixture from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is beans from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is mushroom sauce from Step 2 still available in Step 3?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 1?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to use the mixture in Step 2?
Can we stir (Step 3) and bake (Step 4) at the same time?
